Docs.summary: Allows WPF applications to disable dots per inch (dpi) awareness for all user interface elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] applications are dpi aware, which affects how user interface layout is calculated. However, an application can disable dpi awareness by adding the <xref:System.Windows.Media.DisableDpiAwarenessAttribute> to the application assembly.
> [!CAUTION] > It is **not** recommended that you set this attribute for your application, unless you need all user interface elements of your application to be non-dpi aware.
## Examples The following example shows how to disable Dpi awareness for the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] application by declaring <xref:System.Windows.Media.DisableDpiAwarenessAttribute> at the assembly level.
